title.narrative: Boresha Macho Inclusive Eye Health Project

description.narrative: The project will work collaboratively to build more inclusive eye care within the current health system, meaning that vulnerable people will have access to quality eye care to prevent and treat avoidable blindness. The project focuses on people from marginalised groups including women, the elderly and people living with disabilities. Awareness of the importance of eye care will have an impact on families. Successful cataract surgery will enable patients to return to their families, empowered by their improved vision, now able to participate in work, household chores and community life.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Health, Community Development, Gender, Elderly and Children (MoHCDGEC)
UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office
